Key Arguments: The proposed legislation is compared to historical decrees from dictatorships that suppressed free speech.
The legislation is seen as a tool for narrative enforcement, particularly around topics like climate change.
Free speech is essential for the development of new ideas and societal progress.
Historical examples (Socrates, Martin Luther, Galileo, Bertrand Russell) are used to illustrate the dangers of suppressing dissenting voices.
The legislation is viewed as a means to control public discourse and suppress alternative viewpoints.
Notable Quotes: This Bill is about strengthening narrative enforcement around the ultimate big government crusade - the ‘settled science’ of ‘global boiling.’

Free speech is moral. While it is true that many fringe ideas are best left on the fringe, it is undeniable that most forward leaps for mankind occurred because a fringe idea was given a platform and won the debate.
There was no time in history where the people censoring free speech were the good guys.
